content.content: Standards are being created throughout the Ethereum community… Ethereum EIPs - http://eips.ethereum.org/  Purpose & Guidelines http://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1  Standard Track EIPs  Core - http://eips.ethereum.org/core  Networking - http://eips.ethereum.org/networking  Interface - http://eips.ethereum.org/interface  ERC - http://eips.ethereum.org/erc    Informational EIPs - http://eips.ethereum.org/informational  Meta EIPs - http://eips.ethereum.org/meta   AllCoreDevs - no website  List of meetings and agendas - https://github.com/ethereum/pm  YouTube - https://goo.gl/h9C46k   Ethereum Research - https://ethresear.ch  Sharding phase 1 spec - https://ethresear.ch/t/sharding-phase-1-spec/1407   Web3 Foundation - https://web3.foundation/  Polkadot - https://polkadot.network/  ScalingNOW  Discussion channel: https://riot.im/app/#/room/#ScalingEthereum:matrix.org  Twitter hashtag: https://twitter.com/hashtag/scalingnow     Ethereum Interfaces - https://github.com/ethereum/interfaces/issues  Ethereum Provider API - https://github.com/ethereum/interfaces/issues/16   DevP2P Specification - https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p  Discovery Protocol v4 - https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/blob/master/discv4.md  RLPx: Cryptographic Network & Transport Protocol - https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/blob/master/rlpx.md   EEA working groups - https://entethalliance.org/working-groups/ Website is members-only, but working groups include:  “communications protocols” “integration and tools” “standards” “digital identity”

I’m part of an effort working on more clear and comprehensive software engineering guidelines for smart contract engineers. The working title is SecurEth: SecurEth.org/guidelines/ Definitely a work in progress, but we’re collobrating with major auditing firms and developers in the space, leveraging some of our experience in Aerospace with the DO-178 risk assessment guidelines that we have a collective 30+ years experience with. Honestly might be premature sharing this, but I think it’s important work.

Here’s another one: https://github.com/ewasm/design Note that at present this only applies to the ewasm work being done by the EF ewasm team, and not to the work being done by Parity, Dfinity, or others–although we’re not far apart.
